title.narrative: Modernization of Public Financial Management Systems in Mexico

description.narrative: To improve the coverage and timeliness of public financial information and its use by the Federal Public Administration.

condition.narrative: The Borrower, through SHCP, shall no later than 30 days after the Effective Date, establish and thereafter operate and maintain aTransversal Operating Committee (TOC) with composition and functions acceptable to the Bank as set forth in the Operational Manual.(Schedule 2, Section I.A.1(c))

The Borrower, through SHCP, shall no later than 30 days after the Effective Date, establish and thereafter operate and maintain atall times during Project implementation a Project Administration Unit (PAU) with resources, staffing, and functions all acceptableto the Bank as set forth in the Operational Manual. (Schedule 2, Section I.A.1(a))

The Borrower, through SHCP, shall operate and maintain at all times during Project implementation a steering committee (SteeringCommittee) with composition and functions acceptable to the Bank as set forth in the Operational Manual. (Schedule 2, SectionI.A.1(b))

title.narrative: Share of central government infrastructure projects that are formulated under climate resilience methodologies
Share of budgetary programs with revised program structure and medium-term financial and performance projections aligned with medium-term expenditure framework
Integrated dashboard with strategic and operational information of the following PFM areas has been implemented: budgeting, cash management, accounting, debt management and public investment
Share of administrative units certified on conceptual and operational aspects of integrated PFM processes
Share of units in SHCP using information from a common data warehouse primarily fed by the FMIS
Improved user satisfaction related to accessibility, timeliness and quality of information provided by the fiscal transparency platform
Share of Secretariats managed by a standardized payroll management system
Percentage of core PFM information systems have successfully passed external cyber security audit, during the last 18 months
Share of federal budget directly executed through the IFMIS
Expenditure cycle stages registered on time

baseline.value: A baseline will be constructed as part of project activities during the first year of the project.

target.value: An end target will be constructed as part of project activities during the first year of the project.

actual.value: A baseline will be constructed as part of project activities during the first year of the project.

title.narrative: Core PFM sub-systems are conceptually integrated and technologically connected on-line

baseline.value: Core PFM processes and IT solutions are fragmented (MAP, SIAFF, SICOP, etc)

target.value: All PFM core processes and information systems were reviewed and are technologically interconnected

actual.value: Core PFM processes and IT solutions are fragmented (MAP, SIAFF, SICOP, etc)

title.narrative: Unified IFMIS help desk for internal and external users is in place
Data analytics tools for PFM information have been implemented and used for producing fiscal statistics and reports
Integrated PFM transparency tools are publicly available combining at least information about program results, budgeting, public investment and budget execution

baseline.value: None. SHCP is well scored in terms of budget transparency. SHCP has different portals about budget, public investment andprocurement, and have done important efforts to publish fiscal information. However, these initiatives are not harmonized norintegrated and are heterogenous in terms of incorporating the citizen perspective

target.value: Transparency tools are harmonized and integrated and respond to a citizen perspective that allows to better understand the PFMcycle.

actual.value: None. SHCP is well scored in terms of budget transparency. SHCP has different portals about budget, public investment andprocurement, and have done important efforts to publish fiscal information. However, these initiatives are not harmonized norintegrated and are heterogenous in terms of incorporating the citizen perspective

title.narrative: Interoperability between administrative and core financial management processes implemented

target.value: Resource management information systems are integrated to core PFM systems based on interoperability standards

title.narrative: Stages of the public investment cycle (planning, formulation, registry, budget execution, monitoring, evaluation and transparency) that are integrated within public investment management system

baseline.value: PIM stages, core processes and workflows of information, are fragmented and not integrated to the FMIS.

target.value: All PIM stages, core processes and workflows of information, have been integrated and are technologically interconnected with theFMIS.

actual.value: PIM stages, core processes and workflows of information, are fragmented and not integrated to the FMIS.

title.narrative: Percentage increase of core PFM information systems’ up-time

baseline.value: There is no data about information systems up-time, but there are users complains about stability.An up-time review will be doneduring the first year of the project, and generate a business standard for up-time

target.value: An end target will be defined through the up-time review.

actual.value: There is no data about information systems up-time, but there are users complains about stability.An up-time review will be doneduring the first year of the project, and generate a business standard for up-time

title.narrative: Reduction in the time to produce consolidated budget execution information
